description:
Python 3.3 added ``yield from`` and 3.4 added
```asyncio`` <https://docs.python.org/3/library/asyncio.html>`__. Python
3.5 adds ``async`` and ``await`` from `PEP
492 <https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0492/>`__. What is all this
stuff? Why do we need new syntax? And why should I care?

This talk is about why async programming is worth caring about and why
Python's approach has me so excited.
title: Why should I care about asyncio?
